core

Class Init

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Init

  • public class Init
extends java.lang.Object
    Init.java --- Class used for the initialization of the most important instances.
    Author:
    P H - 18.03.2017

      • init

        public static boolean init(bwapi.Mirror mirror,
                           InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Function for initializing all important Functions in the beginning.
        Parameters:
        mirror - the mirror of the game.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the action as successful or not.

      • convertBWTAPolygons

        private static void convertBWTAPolygons(InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Function for converting the BWTA-Polygon map boundaries into standard Polygons that can be used for pathfinding etc.
        Parameters:
        informationStorage - the location the newly generated Polygons are stored in.

      • generateReversedRegionAccessOrder

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,bwta.Region> generateReversedRegionAccessOrder()
        Function for generating the reversed access order of all Regions of the currently played map. Each entry contains a Region as a key and another one which is the Region a Unit would have to move to to continue moving towards the Player's starting location / its home location. The Region containing the starting location is an entry as well with a value of null since no further Region leads towards the starting location.
        • Key: Any Region of the currently played map.
        • Value: An adjacent Region which leads towards the Player's starting location (If the key is not the Region containing the starting location).
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing Regions mapped to another adjacent Region which leads towards the Player's starting location.

      • generateRegionIndexHashMap

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.lang.Integer> generateRegionIndexHashMap()
        Function used for mapping each Region of the currently played map to an index / Integer. This HashMap functions as a key for the graph that is being created since the graph uses Integers and not objects as its vertices representation. Therefore a way of "encoding" and "decoding" the information is ncecessary.
        Returns:
        a HashMap with each Region of the map mapped to an Integer.

      • addRegionConnectionsToGraph

        private static void addRegionConnectionsToGraph(DirectedGraphList graph,
                                                java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.lang.Integer> regionsMappedToIndices)
        Function for adding edges to a provided graph using the provided indices of the mapped Regions based on the ChokePoints of the map's Regions. This is necessary since the graph that is being used is using an adjacency List which in return uses Integers as an internal representation of its edges.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph to which the edges are being added.
        regionsMappedToIndices - a HashMap which mapped the Regions of the map to Integers that can be used to represent vertices and edges in the graph.

      • generateBreadthOrderToBase

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,bwta.Region> generateBreadthOrderToBase(DirectedGraphList graph,
                                                                                     java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.lang.Integer> regionMappedToIndex)
        Function for generating the order in which the Regions of the currently played maps must be traversed in order to get to the Player's starting location.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph which will be used to determine the order of Regions being traversed.
        regionMappedToIndex - the HashMap containing Integers mapped to Regions for decoding latter.
        Returns:
        a HashMap of Regions mapped to other Regions. The value represents the Region which must be traveled in order to get closer to the Player's starting location.

      • generateBreadthAccessOrder

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>> generateBreadthAccessOrder(InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Function for generating the order in which the different Regions are accessible beginning at the Player's starting location. This function basically returns a HashMap representing the breadth search equivalent and uses the reversed access order of the different Regions of the map.
        Parameters:
        informationStorage - the storages which provides the reversed access order of the Regions.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing the breadth search equivalent of the access order of the different map Regions.
